Post.title: Github ActionHexo
Post._content:
# Hexo
passGithub Action

# github ssh 
id_rsaid_rsa.pubT_T
```cmd
$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "tanxinzheng@139.com" #github
```

# Github
- id_rsasettings/secures
- id_rsa.pubsettings/SSH keys

# Github Action

~./.github/workflows/main.yml

```yml
name: CI
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - generate-source
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout source
        uses: actions/checkout@v1
        with:
          ref: generate-source
      - name: Use Node.js ${{ matrix.node_version }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v1
        with:
          version: ${{ matrix.node_version }}
      - name: Setup hexo
        env:
          ACTION_DEPLOY_KEY: ${{ secrets.HEXO_DEPLOY_PRI }}
        run: |
          mkdir -p ~/.ssh/
          echo "$ACTION_DEPLOY_KEY" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa
          chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa
          ssh-keyscan github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
          git config --global user.email "tanxinzheng@139.com"
          git config --global user.name "tanxinzheng"
          npm install hexo-cli -g
          npm install
      - name: Hexo deploy
        run: |
          hexo clean
          hexo d
```

# Github Action
Github Actionpush

```yml
      - name: Checkout source
        uses: actions/checkout@v1
        with:
          ref: generate-source
      - name: Use Node.js ${{ matrix.node_version }}

      - name: Setup hexo

          mkdir -p ~/.ssh/

          ssh-keyscan github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
          git config --global user.email "tanxinzheng@139.com"
          git config --global user.name "tanxinzheng"
          npm install hexo-cli -g
          npm install
      - name: Hexo deploy
        run: |
          hexo clean
          hexo d
```

Post.title: Hexo
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

### JVM


    -Xmx4g Xms4g Xmn1200m Xss512k -XX:NewRatio=4 -XX:SurvivorRatio=8 -XX:PermSize=100m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -XX:MaxTenuringThreshold=15

Java7Java8-XX:PermSize-XXMaxPermSize


```
-Xmx4g4GB
-Xms4g4GB
-Xmn1200m1200MBSun3/8
-Xss512kJDK5.01MB256K3000~5000
-XX:NewRatio=4EdenSurvivor4141/5
-XX:SurvivorRatio=8EdenSurvivor8SurvivorEden2:8Survivor1/10
-XX:PermSize=100m100MB
-XX:MaxPermSize=256m256MB
-XX:MaxTenuringThreshold=150SurvivorSurvivor
```



```
-Xms1/64(1GB)
-Xmx(MaxHeapFreeRatio)70%JVM-Xms
-XmnEden2Survivor
-XX:SurvivorRatio=1EdenSurvivor1:1
-XX:MaxDirectMemorySize=1Gjava.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Direct buffer memory
-XX:+DisableExplicitGCSystem.gc()fulll GC
-XX:CMSInitiatingOccupancyFraction=6068
-XX:ConcGCThreads=4CMSCPU
-XX:ParallelGCThreads=8
-XX:MaxTenuringThreshold=100SurvivorSurvivor
-XX:CMSFullGCsBeforeCompaction=4fullGCtenured 
-XX:CMSMaxAbortablePrecleanTime=500abortable-preclean
```
> : Java RMIGC-Dsun.rmi.dgc.server.gcInterval=86400

Post.title: LinuxrootSSH
Post._content:
Linux/UbuntuECS+SSHroot
Linux/UbunturootadminSSH

# 
## SSH Key
SSH Key

    $ ls -a ~/.ssh
    .		..		authorized_keys	id_rsa		id_rsa.pub	known_hosts

## SSH Key
~/.sshid_rsaid_rsa.pub

     # 
     ~$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@example.com"   
     Enter file in which to save the key (/your_home_path/.ssh/id_rsa): 
     Enter passphrase (empty for no passphrase): 
     Enter same passphrase again: 
     Your identification has been saved in /your_home_path/.ssh/id_rsa.
     Your public key has been saved in /your_home_path/.ssh/id_rsa.pub.
     The key fingerprint is:
     SHA256:YgZkAauw6YCWAWwvfiMgJ7zBGkVbFqgRxQ7hdet5nGY your_email@example.com
     The key's randomart image is:
     +---[RSA 2048]----+
     |BO=++o           |
     |Bo++. .          |
     |oOo ..           |
     |+==...o .        |
     |X+.  o+ES        |
     |=X + o+.         |
     |.oX .            |
     |..               |
     |                 |
     +----[SHA256]-----+

# 

root
## 
    
    useradd admin
    passwd admin
    vi /etc/sudoers                                 # susudoers
    admin ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL                         # 

## ssh key
root
> <font color=red>****</font>

     mkdir /home/admin/.ssh
     chmod 700 /home/admin/.ssh                       
     vi /home/admin/.ssh/authorized_keys            #authorized_keysid_rsa.pubauthorized_keys
     chmod 600 /home/admin/.ssh/authorized_keys     #authorized_keys
     chown -R admin:admin /home/admin/.ssh/         #
     systemctl stop sshd                            #ssh
     systemctl start sshd                           #ssh

## SSH
> **SSHroot**

     # SSH 
     vi /etc/ssh/sshd_config
     PermitRootLogin no                             # rootroot
     PasswordAuthentication no                      # +
     # ssh
     systemctl stop sshd
     systemctl start sshd
     
# 
iphostsip
## ip

    vi /etc/hosts
    xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx   my-remote-server              # ipip  

## ssh
    
    ssh admin@xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx                       # ip
    ssh admin@my-remote-server                      #

Linux/UbuntuECS+SSHroot
Linux/UbunturootadminSSH

SSH Key

SSH Key

$ ls -a ~/.ssh
.        ..        authorized_keys    id_rsa        id_rsa.pub    known_hosts

SSH Key

~/.sshid_rsaid_rsa.pub

# 
~$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@example.com"   
Enter file in which to save the key (/your_home_path/.ssh/id_rsa): 
Enter passphrase (empty for no passphrase): 
Enter same passphrase again: 
Your identification has been saved in /your_home_path/.ssh/id_rsa.
Your public key has been saved in /your_home_path/.ssh/id_rsa.pub.
The key fingerprint is:
SHA256:YgZkAauw6YCWAWwvfiMgJ7zBGkVbFqgRxQ7hdet5nGY your_email@example.com
The key's randomart image is:
+---[RSA 2048]----+
|BO=++o           |
|Bo++. .          |
|oOo ..           |
|+==...o .        |
|X+.  o+ES        |
|=X + o+.         |
|.oX .            |
|..               |
|                 |
+----[SHA256]-----+


root

useradd admin
passwd admin
vi /etc/sudoers                                 # susudoers
admin ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL                         #

ssh key

root

mkdir /home/admin/.ssh
chmod 700 /home/admin/.ssh                       
vi /home/admin/.ssh/authorized_keys            #authorized_keysid_rsa.pubauthorized_keys
chmod 600 /home/admin/.ssh/authorized_keys     #authorized_keys
chown -R admin:admin /home/admin/.ssh/         #
systemctl stop sshd                            #ssh
systemctl start sshd                           #ssh

PermitRootLogin no                             # rootroot
PasswordAuthentication no                      # +
# ssh
systemctl stop sshd
systemctl start sshd

iphostsip

ip

vi /etc/hosts
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx   my-remote-server              # ipip

ssh

ssh admin@my-remote-server                      #
